snippet: Won Sei-hoon was accused of being involved in a secretive campaign in which his agency hired bloggers to post negative commentaries about rivals of President Park Geun-hye.
abstract: South Korean state prosecutors say they will indict Won Sei-hoon, former chief of country's National Intelligence Service, on charges of illegally trying to influence December election in favor of Park Geun-hye, who was elected president.
lead_paragraph: Won Sei-hoon was accused of being involved in a secretive campaign in which his agency hired bloggers to post negative commentaries about rivals of President Park Geun-hye.

headline.seo: South Korean Ex-Official Accused of Interfering in Election
headline.main: South Korean Ex-Official Accused of Interfering in Election
headline.print_headline: South Korean Ex-Official Accused of Interfering in Election
